item.title: Women Who Manage Climate Disasters Are Generally the Last to Get Funding
item.description: World leaders are gathering in Brazil for the annual United Nations climate change conference to debate the urgent need for global action. Every year, billions of dollars are pledged in the name of such movement. Yet, every year, the women leading real climate remedies, those on the frontlines rebuilding homes, caring for families and replanting ... Read more

item.title: Safeguarding clean water access as climate threats rise
item.description: As health emergencies multiply linked to the climate crisis, governments are joining forces with the UN to protect access to clean water, while data indicates that 118 million people in Europe alone live near healthcare facilities lacking basic sanitation.
